Exaggeration of the strength of the U: S. economy: The expert points out that President Trump falsely claimed that the U.S. had the greatest economy in the history of the country and the world, which is an exaggeration.
Comparison of economic growth under the: The expert highlights that the real GDP growth under the Trump administration was 2.3% in 2019, lower than the 2.9% in 2018. They also mention that there have been 19 instances in the past 39 years where real economic growth exceeded Trump's peak year.
Manufacturing job numbers: The expert points out that President Trump slightly exaggerated the number of manufacturing jobs by stating that there were up to 600,000 jobs prior to the pandemic. The actual peak under Trump was 499,000 manufacturing jobs, as of November 2019, according to the Bureau of Labor Statistics.
Meaningless boast about: most people working": The expert mentions that President Trump repeated a meaningless boast about "most people working" without providing any specific data or evidence to support this claim.
